publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-755 Mr Stewart Maxwell: Pregnant and Productive: An Investigation into Pregnancy Discriminationâ€”That the Parliament welcomes the first ever investigation into pregnancy discrimination which has been launched by the Equal Opportunities Commission (EOC); notes with concern that the EOC helpline receives more calls from women facing problems at work because of pregnancy than on any other subject; further expresses alarm that women have been demoted, disciplined or sacked simply for having a baby; strongly believes that the Scottish economy needs the skills and experience of pregnant women in the workplace and women returning from maternity leave, and calls on the Scottish Executive to act upon the findings of the investigation to put a stop to pregnancy discrimination.
S2M-755 Pregnant and Productive: An Investigation into Pregnancy Discrimination (lodged on 5 January 2004) Carolyn Leckie*, Frances Curran*, Richard Lochhead*, Ms Sandra White*, Alex Neil*

S2M-755 Pregnant and Productive: An Investigation into Pregnancy Discrimination (lodged on 5 January 2004) Jackie Baillie*, Elaine Smith*, Mike Pringle*, Stewart Stevenson*, Shona Robison*, Shiona Baird*, Rob Gibson*, Jim Mather*, Christine Grahame*, Mr Bruce McFee*, Kate Maclean*, Michael Matheson*
S2M-755 Pregnant and Productive: An Investigation into Pregnancy Discrimination (lodged on 5 January 2004) Chris Ballance*, Eleanor Scott*, Tommy Sheridan*, Ms Rosemary Byrne*

S2M-755 Mr Stewart Maxwell: Pregnant and Productive: An Investigation into Pregnancy Discrimination-That the Parliament welcomes the first ever investigation into pregnancy discrimination which has been launched by the Equal Opportunities Commission (EOC); notes with concern that the EOC helpline receives more calls from women facing problems at work because of pregnancy than on any other subject; further expresses alarm that women have been demoted, disciplined or sacked simply for having a baby; strongly believes that the Scottish economy needs the skills and experience of pregnant women in the workplace and women returning from maternity leave, and calls on the Scottish Executive to act upon the findings of the investigation to put a stop to pregnancy discrimination. Supported by: Carolyn Leckie, Frances Curran, Richard Lochhead, Ms Sandra White, Alex Neil, Jackie Baillie, Elaine Smith, Mike Pringle, Stewart Stevenson, Shona Robison, Shiona Baird, Rob Gibson, Jim Mather, Christine Grahame, Mr Bruce McFee, Kate Maclean, Michael Matheson, Chris Ballance, Eleanor Scott, Tommy Sheridan, Ms Rosemary Byrne, Robin Harper*
S2M-755 Pregnant and Productive: An Investigation into Pregnancy Discrimination (lodged on 5 January 2004) Dr Jean Turner*, Donald Gorrie*
S2M-755 Pregnant and Productive: An Investigation into Pregnancy Discrimination (lodged on 5 January 2004) Mr Adam Ingram*
S2M-755 Pregnant and Productive: An Investigation into Pregnancy Discrimination (lodged on 5 January 2004) Fiona Hyslop*
S2M-755 Pregnant and Productive: An Investigation into Pregnancy Discrimination (lodged on 5 January 2004) Colin Fox*
S2M-755 Pregnant and Productive: An Investigation into Pregnancy Discrimination (lodged on 5 January 2004) Susan Deacon*
S2M-755 Pregnant and Productive: An Investigation into Pregnancy Discrimination (lodged on 5 January 2004) Rosie Kane*
S2M-755 Pregnant and Productive: An Investigation into Pregnancy Discrimination (lodged on 5 January 2004) Pauline McNeill*
